moves.1. d4:
please note that i will use these abbreviations : o-o or o-o-o = castling, !! = very good move, ! = good move, ?? = very bad move, ? = bad move, !? = may be good, may be bad.

to be in the center.
moves.2. Bf4: develop and to be in a good position.
moves.3... e6: to open the way for the bishop.
moves.4. Nf3: developing the other knight and preparing for o-o.
moves.4... b6: to open the way for the bishop.
moves.5... Bb7: to be ready to attack the king side.
moves.7. Bd3: preparing for o-o and to be in a better position.
moves.8. Ne5: to be in an attacking position.
moves.11... d6: the same plus attacking my knight.
moves.14. Nc2: to be in a safe place before duple attack ( my knight and my bishop ) with ... c4
moves.16... h6: attacking my bishop to stop pinning black knight. !
moves.18. Bg3 Nxe5: now it is safe to capture my knight.
moves.20. Bh5+: check and to be in an attacking position to the king. !
moves.21. h3 Bc6 22. b3 b5 23. b4: to close the way of the black bishop.
moves.24. Be2 Qd7 25. f4 Kh7: to release the pinning of the knight.
moves.26. fxg5: to make black king open for attacks. ( uncovered )
moves.30... Rh6: to enforce protection of the knight.
moves.31. Rh1: to enforce protection of h pawn.
moves.31... Rah8: to put more pressure on h pawn.
moves.32. Be2 Qd8 33. a4: to start attacking from the queen side. !
moves.33... Kf8: trying to release pinning of the knight, but it is still pinned.
moves.34... fxg4:
capturing the pawn in g4 in the king side. ?? mistake 
he thought that he can put more pressure on my king side. 
he should capture the pawn in b5.
moves.35. bxa6: now there is a good chance to promote. !!
moves.35... gxh3+: to regain the lost material and to put more pressure on my king.
moves.36. Kf1: king went back to f1 in a safe place.
moves.36... Qa8: black queen run to a8 to stop the coming promotion.
moves.37. b5: to enforce "a" pawn and to free the rock in a1. !
moves.37... Bd8: bishop came to help the queen.
moves.38. Qb1: white queen came to help "b" pawn to be promoted.
moves.38... Bb6: bishop to stop promotion of "b" pawn.
moves.39. Qb4+: queen to attack and help from the opponent side.
moves.41. Nb4: knight came to help and put more pressure.
moves.41... Rd8: attacking my queen. !  there is no safe room for my queen except c6, but ... Be8 will put my queen in a corner.
moves.42. Nc6:
knight forking queen and rock. !!
ready to exchange queens if my opponent likes and to give my queen a pass to run back.
moves.42... Rxd6:
rock capture the queen.
my opponent decided to exchange.
moves.43... Rd7: black rock was in danger, so it run to a safe place and attacking my knight. !
moves.44. Nc8: knight run to a safe place attacking black bishop. !
moves.44... Bc7: black bishop attacking white bishop. but white bishop was protected.
moves.45. a7:
45. a7  !! very good move.
now it is a very good chance for "a" pawn to go - well protected by rock and knight - for promotion.
at this position my opponent resigned.
conclusion : 1- my opponent is a very good chess player, he made a mistake, but we all make mistakes. 2- annotation is a very hard job, i hope that my friend the reader will appreciate what i have done and may be the beginners will learn some thing. 3- your advice and comments will be appreciated with my thanks. 4- i like you all. 5- thank you. 6- a lot of thanks to GameKnot. friend of all mustafa
